content.description: Crux is in the traverse across the middle and working your way up the deep holes.  Start and top out are pretty tame.
content.protection: Existing eye bolt anchor at the top

content.description: Crux is first move. A little easier than Mountain Goat's crux.
content.protection: Existing eye bolt anchor at the top

content.description: The second move is the hardest.  Using the knee or lower body flexibility is key to solving this one.
content.protection: Existing eye bolt anchor at the top
content.location: Start at the large ledge at the start of the blue line in the photo.

content.description: Crux is moving up past the THU in the photo. It is a top anchor, however the only anchor is way to the right, so if you slip you will take a good swing. Also Fall Out so you don't hit the 1' rock projection on your right, Boy will that hurt.
content.protection: Existing eye bolt anchor at the top

content.description: Crux is the same as The Don Wall. However this start is a little tougher, so the full climb should leave you a little more exhausted.
content.protection: Existing eye bolt anchor at the top

content.description: Crux is about 2/3 of the way up. It looks like nice big holes for your hands, but they are tricky.  Look for small pockets to the sides to perhaps get past this section. Your feet are better served by these holes.
content.protection: Existing eye bolt anchor at the top

content.description: Crux is working your way up the smooth 1' face that looks like it wouldn't be that difficult.  A crack would be great here, but none exists. Top anchor is far to the right so a nice swing awaits for those who come off.
content.protection: Existing eye bolt anchor at the top

content.description: Mt. Simon is a hard sandstone rock that juts up about 30' on the upper part of Mt. Simon Park in the city of Eau Claire.  Beautiful views from the top, the west side has a easy hike to the top of the rock, while the east face is the climbing side.  Feel free to drop any opinions on ratings as my experience to ratings is minimal, but wanted to put Eau Claire on the climbing map with the location.  Enjoy the view!
